title: Mobile Learning Application Development and Evaluation: Application of Design-Based Research

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational science theories, practical experience in the field, and e-learning tool utilization
context.additional_context: In-service elementary science practitioners experience the mobile learning application development process while exploring methods to digitize existing content

learning_goals: Learners can design mobile learning application prototypes by applying Design-Based Research (DBR) methodology
Learners can propose three digital content conversion strategies based on practical knowledge in science fields
Learners can generate feedback to improve technical/educational elements of applications based on formative assessment results
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
